forces.utils_forces¶

forces.utils_forces.build_merge(local_maxes, local_mins)[source]¶

Builds an ordered list of maxima and minima along the time axis.

Parameters

  • local_maxes (list of tuples) – The list of local maxima.

  • local_mins (list of tuples) – The list of local minima.

Returns

A merged list of minima and maxima ordered by time.

Return type

list of tuples

forces.utils_forces.calculate_derivative(p1, p2)[source]¶

Calculates the derivative (slope) between two points.

Parameters

  • p1 (tuple of float) – The first point (x1, y1).

  • p2 (tuple of float) – The second point (x2, y2).

Returns

The slope between the two points.

Return type

float

forces.utils_forces.calculate_mean_rooted_derivative(p1, p2, l)[source]¶

Calculates the mean rooted derivative between two points within a list.

Parameters

  • p1 (tuple of float) – The first point (x1, y1).

  • p2 (tuple of float) – The second point (x2, y2).

  • l (list of tuples) – The list of points to search within.

Returns

The mean rooted derivative between p1 and p2.

Return type

float

forces.utils_forces.find_a_pattern(merged_mins_maxes_coordinates, coordinates, p0_spike, p2_spike, MRD_value)[source]¶

Finds a specific pattern in the list of merged minima and maxima coordinates.

Parameters

  • merged_mins_maxes_coordinates (list of tuples) – The list of merged minima and maxima coordinates.

  • coordinates (list of tuples) – The list of original coordinates.

  • p0_spike (float) – The threshold for the first peak.

  • p2_spike (float) – The threshold for the second peak.

  • MRD_value (float) – The minimum mean rooted derivative value to qualify as a pattern.

Returns

A tuple indicating whether a pattern was found, and the points involved in the pattern.

Return type

tuple (bool, tuple, tuple, tuple)

forces.utils_forces.find_patterns(merged_mins_maxes_coordinates, coordinates, p0_spike, p2_spike, MRD_value)[source]¶

Finds specific patterns in the list of merged minima and maxima coordinates.

Parameters

  • merged_mins_maxes_coordinates (list of tuples) – The list of merged minima and maxima coordinates.

  • coordinates (list of tuples) – The list of original coordinates.

  • p0_spike (float) – The threshold for the first peak.

  • p2_spike (float) – The threshold for the second peak.

  • MRD_value (float) – The minimum mean rooted derivative value to qualify as a pattern.

forces.utils_forces.find_value(time, list)[source]¶

Finds the value at a specific time within a list of points.

Parameters

  • time (float) – The time to search for.

  • list (list of tuples) – The list of points to search within.

Returns

The point corresponding to the given time, or None if not found.

Return type

tuple or None

forces.utils_forces.gradient_ascent(list_point_derivative)[source]¶

Performs gradient ascent to find a local maximum in the list of points.

Parameters

list_point_derivative (list of tuples) – A list of points with their derivatives.

Returns

The point corresponding to the local maximum found.

Return type

tuple

forces.utils_forces.gradient_descent(list_point_derivative)[source]¶

Performs gradient descent to find a local minimum in the list of points.

Parameters

list_point_derivative (list of tuples) – A list of points with their derivatives.

Returns

The point corresponding to the local minimum found.

Return type

tuple

forces.utils_forces.monte_carlo_gradient(direction, l)[source]¶

Performs Monte Carlo gradient ascent or descent to find local extrema.

Parameters

  • direction (int) – The direction to search in; negative for descent, positive for ascent.

  • l (list of tuples) – The list of points to search within.

Returns

A list of local maxima or minima found.

Return type

list of tuples
